trs: Speak!

imtwordshtml: fut=1pl-neg-prs-2-walk-appl-fv=17(loc)
trs: We will not visit them there
(intended: They give the boy money.')}
(intended: \lq The boy gives himself money.')}

src: bo i-kʊ-gon-a mu-n-k-iina mula$\sim$mu-la ɪ-n-jala j-a-n̩-dʊm-aga fiijo, a-lɪnkʊ-tendeel-a pa-mwanya ʊkʊtɪ a-sook-e a-bʊʊk-e n-kʊ-ly-a. a-lɪnkw-ag-a ɪ-n-giisi jɪ-li=po ngatɪ mu-ndʊ ɪɪm-ile=\textbf{po}, ngɪmba ii-syanjʊ lɪ-n̩-gw-ɪl-iile=\textbf{po}
trs: While he [Hare] was staying there in the pit, he was plagued by hunger. He had a look upwards to leave and go to eat. He found there was darkness, as if a person was standing \textbf{there}, in fact a leaf had fallen (\textbf{there}) on him.' [Saliki and Hare]
\lq On the other side, he started to run without looking \textbf{back}.' [Saliki and Hare]

src: n-kamu gw-angʊ Pakyɪndɪ, ɪɪ-ng’ombe si-k-oonang-a fiijo a-ma-jabʊ ga-ako a-ka-balɪlo a-ka-a pa-muu-si, n-gʊ-kʊ-sʊʊm-a ʊkʊtɪ ʊ-bʊʊk-e ʊ-ka-sigɪl-e=\textbf{ko} paapo a-ma-jabʊ g-oonang-iike fiijo
trs: My friend Pakyindi, the cows are destroying your cassava during the day, I beg you go and have a look \textbf{there}, because the cassava is very spoiled.' [Sokoni and Pakyindi]

src: bo a-fik-ile a-a-jɪ-bwene ɪ-n-deko jɪ-lɪ pa-m-ooto. a-a-kuputwile, a-aly-eg-ile\textbf{=mo} ɪ-fi-balali
trs: When she arrived, she saw that the pot was on the fire. She uncovered it, she took \textbf{out} pieces [of the food].' [Thieving woman]

src: gw-ijʊʊl-e ʊ-kʊ-lond-a ʊ-bʊ-jo ʊ-bʊ-nunu ʊ-bw-a kʊ-jeng-a=\textbf{po}
trs: You should try to look for a good place to build \textbf{on}.' [How to build modern houses]

src: kangɪ na=nungwe kʊ-m-bon-a lɪnga a-ka-ndʊ ka-mo ka-m-balamaasiisye=\textbf{po} ʊ-m̩-bɪlɪ gw-angʊ, n-gw-andʊl-a ɪ-my-enda ɪ-gɪ m-fwele, nakalɪnga n-gʊ-fwal-a ɪ-gɪ-ngɪ ɪ-mi-nunu ɪ-gy-a lʊ-ko ʊ-lʊ-ngɪ
trs: You too see me [habitually], when something touches my body \textbf{a bit}, I change the clothes I wear and immediately put on other beautiful ones of a different type.' [Hare and Chameleon]

src: lʊmo bo a-bomb-ile=\textbf{po} \textbf{panandɪ} kw-ag-aga a-b-eene na=fyo b-iis-ile kʊ-kw-eg-a
trs: \lq Or when he has worked \textbf{for a little while}, you will find they [owner of the tools] have come to take them back.' [Types of tools in the home]%das BSP muss drin sein wegen po panandI
\lq Sing \textbf{a little} for us again, Mr. Monster, play again!' (Monster with Guitar)

src: a-a-bop-ile mw-ene, a-a-bop-ile mw-ene kalʊlʊ. mwa=n-dugutu \textbf{a}-\textbf{ka}-\textbf{a}-\textbf{bop}-\textbf{ile}=\textbf{po}
srcwordshtml: a-ka-a-bop-ile=po
trs: He [Hare] had run alone, Hare had run alone. Mr. Tugutu did not run at all.' [Hare and Tugutu]

src: ʊ-gwe kʊ-job-a ɪ-s-ingi itolo ɪ-si \textbf{a}-\textbf{ka}-\textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{lagɪl}-\textbf{a}=\textbf{po}, fiki ʊ-ti-kʊ-pɪlɪkɪsy-a kanunu?
srcwordshtml: a-ka-kʊ-lagɪl-a=po,
trs: ‎‎You say many things that he hasn't told you at all, why don't you listen properly?' [Saliki and Hare]
Drink a little!
You should rest a little.
That village is a bit far.' [ET]

src: bo end-ile=po n-ky-eni=\textbf{po} \textbf{panandɪ}, a-lɪnkʊ-ba-bon-a Jaakobo na Johani, a-ba-nya-Sebetai
trs: \lq When he had gone a little farther, he saw James son of Zebedee and his brother John.' (Mark 1:19)\footnotemark
\lq This house is bigger than that one' [ET]

src: ʊ-mw-ana ʊ-jʊ a-lɪ na=a-ma-hala ʊ-kʊ-kɪnd-a=\textbf{po} ʊ-jʊ-ngɪ ʊ-jʊ
trs: \lq This child is cleverer than this other one.' [ET]

src: bo ka-kɪnd-ile=po a-ka-balɪlo ka-nandɪ, Pakyindi a-lɪnkʊ-bʊʊk-a kʊ-n̩-gʊnda
trs: \lq When a short time had passed, Pakyindi went to the field.' [Paykindi and Sokoni]
\lq This boy works better than this one.' [ET]

src: \textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{pepe}=\textbf{po} ɪ-n-gamila ʊ-kw-end-a pa-bw-asi bw-a sindaano ʊ-kʊ-kɪnd-a ʊ-n-kabi ʊ-kw-ingɪl-a m̩-bʊ-nyafyale bw-a Kyala
trs: \lq It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of God.' (Mark 10:25)
\lq This dog is fierce, that one is fiercer.' [ET]

src: n-ambɪliile fy-osa ɪ-fi mu-m-b-eele, kangɪ \textbf{n}=\textbf{ʊ}-\textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{kɪnd}-\textbf{a}=\textbf{po} \textbf{palɪ} ɪ-fi n-aa-lond-aga

src: ʊ-ka-bagɪl-a ʊ-kʊ-n-dol-a ʊ-ne, paapo ɪ-fi-nyamaana bo ɪ-m-babala, ɪɪ-senjebele n=ɪ-fi-nyamaana ɪ-fi-ngɪ, ɪ-fi ʊ-fi-meenye ʊkʊtɪ fi-kʊ-bop-a fiijo ʊ-lʊ-bɪlo, fy-ope fi-gel-\textbf{ile}=\textbf{mo} ʊ-kʊ-tolana na=niine, fy-osa n-aa-fi-tol-ile
trs: You can't beat me, because animals like Gazelle, Zebra and many animals that you know to race fast have [at some point] tried to compete with me, I beat them all.' [Hare and Chameleon]
We met [at least once before].' [ET]
Have you ever eaten pineapple?' [ET]

src: a-ka-balɪlo ka-mo a-alɪ-m̩-bwene n=ʊ-n-nyambala ʊ-jʊ-ngɪ mu-n̩-gʊnda ʊ-gw-a ma-jabʊ ʊ-gw-a n̩-dʊme bo i-kʊ-logw-a. leelo Sokoni a-ka-alɪ-m̩-bʊʊl-ile=\textbf{mo} ʊ-n̩-dʊme
trs: ‎‎One time he [Sokoni] saw her with another man in her husband's cassava field while was having sex. But Sokoni did not ever tell the husband.' [Sokoni and Pakyindi]

src: po na=jʊ-mo a-ti-kw-i-tuufy-a=\textbf{mo} kʊʊ-nongwa j-aa m-bombo ɪ-si i-kʊ-bomb-a
trs: \lq So no one ever praises oneself for the work s/he does.' [Division of labour]
\lq I have never ever put on a thick jacket.' [ET]

src: ba-lɪnkʊ-j-a ba-ndʊ b-a lʊ-sulumanio fiijo ʊ-kʊ-kong-an-a n=\textbf{ʊkʊsita} \textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{kab}-\textbf{a}=\textbf{mo} ʊ-mw-ana na=jʊ-mo n-katɪ m̩-bʊ-ʊmi bw-abo
trs: They became very sad because they did not [ever in all that time] get even a single child in their life.' [Pregnant women]
They were never ever working.' [ET]
He is somewhat of a friend of mine.' [overheard]
Is it close to Lwangwa?' -- \lq No, it is somewhat far.' [ET]

src: i-kw-eg-a ɪ-n-jɪnga, a-ka-bagɪl-a pa-kʊ-pot-a, paapo a-fuleele ɪ-kɪ-lʊndɪ. \textbf{i}-\textbf{kʊ}-\textbf{sook}-\textbf{a}=\textbf{po}.
trs: He takes the bike, he cannot ride it, because he has injured his leg. He sets off.' [Elisha pear story]

src: popaa$\sim$po ʊ-mu-ndʊ jʊ-la a-lɪnkʊ-bʊʊk-a pa-kɪ-syanjʊ pa-kʊ-tʊʊsy-a, a-lɪnkʊ-j-aag-a ɪɪ-nyama. a-lɪnkʊ-jɪ-koolel-a ɪ-m-bwa j-aake, a-lɪnkʊ-p-a=\textbf{po} ʊkʊtɪ jɪ-ly-ege
trs: That man went into the thicket to rest, he found the meat. He called his dog, he gave [the meat] \textbf{to} \textbf{him} to eat.' [Dogs laughed at each other]

src: ba-lɪnkʊ-m'-bʊʊl-a ʊkʊtɪ iik-e paa-si \textbf{a}-\textbf{ly}-\textbf{e}=\textbf{mo} ɪ-fi-ndʊ ɪ-fi ba-alɪ-n-twal-iile
trs: \lq They told her to come down and eat the food they brought for her.' [Myfage turns into a lion]
When Hare and Spider had eaten they went home.' [Hare and Spider]
What do you want?'[overheard]
Where have they come from?' [ET]
